@@ -84,6 +89,7 @@
         <script src="/__/firebase/init.js"></script>
 
         <script src="scripts/profile.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
+        <script src="scripts/home.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
body: Why do we have home.js in the profile page?

This only takes the user to the page they were on, before they came to the profile page. What if the user was on the questions page, then type `pastpaperhub.com/profile` in the address bar, then changes their profile and clicked `save`, I think they would be shown int questions page instead of the home page. A better way to handle this is by using something like `window.location.href = "/"`

The closing curly bracket of this line is not the same as the closing culry bracket for the lines below (for 50% and 100%). could you please choose one consistent format and follow that? You could find follow Google's css style guide: https://google.github.io/styleguide/htmlcssguide.html (adding this to coding doc)
Missing a new line here. Each code file must have a new empty line at the end
